lines.text: Hey, bud. How was your second date with the mysterious "Jay," huh?
A dud. Big time! I mean, once I got past the sexy eyes, the gorgeous cheekbones, I saw the squid beneath the skin!
Oh, what a drag!
You're telling me! He spent half the evening picking apart Bela Lugosi's acting, and the other half staring at his own bad self in the bathroom mirror!
He doesn't like Bela?
Mmm, mmm.
Well piss on him, then!
Come back, Curtis! You know you're longing for the sting of the needle, the burn of electrodes on your skin!
I didn't kill anyone.
OF COURSE YOU DID!
Are you alright, Curtis? You're acting really weird.
Oh geez, I'm sorry, Joce! I guess finding disembowled dead guys in my cubicle just throws me right the fuck off!
Oh Blob, I wish I knew what's going on
Isn't that obvious? You're a psycho killer.
[Curtis awakes as he hears loud knocks on the apartment door]

[her voice is heard from outside the door]
Craig! Open this goddamned door right now!
[Curtis gets up and opens the door. Detective Powel stands there]

[sarcastically]
Oh, good morning, detective
[gestures her to enter]

[enters]
Where the hell were you last night? Where were you?
I was with Therese, at the Borderline. Then I came home. What, you wanna ask my rat for an alibi?
I know you were at the Borderline, Craig. At least twenty people saw you there with Therese, not an hour before she was murdered at the bathroom.

[leans weakly on the wall]
What happened?

[teasingly]
Oh, I think you know.

[angrily slams his fist against the wall]
Damn it, I didn't kill her!
[approaches detective Powel. She places her hand on her gun]
I think you did, asshole! It's just a matter of time before you are arrested. I just hope to God that happens before you slaughter anyone else!
I liked Therese. I wouldn't have hurt her. Not ever.
Is that right? You two had a strange way of showing your... affection
[gesturing at the scars on Curtis' body, the result of his sexual experience with Therese]
Please, detective, I need to know what happened to Therese.
A lot happened to Miss Banning, actually. I guess the short version would be that someone strung her up and fried her in her very own blood.
Oh, god. Whoever it is, I swear to god I'll get him.

[teasingly]
I'm sure the good people of the city will rest easier knowing that.

[angrily]
Why don't you go after Paul Warner? He's the one who's behind all this! He'd do anything to protect that... that Threshold project, whatever the hell that is.
who gave you that information? Space aliens?

[furiously]
Get out. Get the hell out!
Fine! But I'll be back, you son of a bitch. I'll be back to nail your ass to the wall!
[leaves]
[Curtis is awakened by the telephone ring. He gets up and answers the phone]
Hello?
Good morning, Mr. Craig. This is Rosalyn of WynTech. I've been asked to call everyone in your department and let you know we don't need you to come in today.
Why?
The... there's been another murder, Mr. Craig.
Who? Who was that?
I... I'm not in liberty to say, Mr. Craig.

[raising his voice]
Goddamit, who? Who was that?
It was Tom. Tom Ravell.
[Curtis is stunned to hear that. After a moment he puts the receiver back]
[Shortly after hearing that Tom was murdered, Curtis hears a knock on the door and opens it. Detective Powell stands there]
Where were you last night, Craig? Where were you?

[sarcastically]
Oh, it's nice to see you too, detective.
[gestures her to enter]
Com'n in.

[enters]
What were you doing last night between the hours 8PM and midnight?

[shrugs]
I was here, with Therese Banning.

[taking notes]
Really? How late did she stay?
I don't know, late. I...
[hears strange noise. He looks around, but sees nothing out of the ordinary. Detective Powell looks at him strangely]
I am... went... went to bed, and when I woke she was gone.
Where is she now?
I don't know, I...
[notices something comes out of the ceiling]
Craig! I said - where is she now?
I don't know. She probably went home. I... I don't know where she lives.
[looks at the ceiling]
Why don't you know where your girlfriend lives, Mr. Craig?
She's not my girlfriend.
Oh, really? You two must be very good friends then. Mr. Craig, do you know of anyone who hated Tom Ravell?
Tom had a huge fight with Paul Warner yesterday. They got to the point they were screaming in each other faces.
Really? About what?
About you, detective. And of Warner making us come to work today after Bob was killed.
You know what, Craig? I think there is something badly wrong with you. I'd love to haul your psycho ass in, but unfortunately I don't have enough evidence - yet.
[Curtis sees again something coming out of the ceiling]
Christ, you're screwed up!
[Curtis tries desperately to regain composure, knowing that what he sees cannot be real]
If you're guilty, Craig, I'll find you
[Curtis sees a huge hand with claws coming down from the ceiling towards detective Powell' head, and he tries not to scream]
no matter where you are, no matter how big a rock you crawl under!
[she looks up, but sees nothing]
Hello, do you hear me? Damn!
[leaves]
[Curtis hears a knock on the door]
Who's there?
It's me, Curtis. Jocilyn.
[Curtis opens the door. Jocilyn enters, looks sad and worried. They hug, pressing their foreheads. Jocilyn kisses Curtis on his forehead. They sit on the sofa. Curtis takes off his glasses]
God, Curtis, I... I just feel like the whole world is coming apart. You know, I... I liked Tom. I really did. I miss him. Nice guy, you know.
I know, Joce. I know. I liked him, too. It just doesn't make any sense.
Curtis... can we go away for the weekend? I just... really need to get away from all this. I...
I'd like to, Joce. I really would. I... it just that I've got some really important things to do.

[offended]
Damn it, Curtis. Why can't you ever talk with me about anything what really matters?
Joce, I...
You know, it might be wrong in face of everything that just happened, right now, I just really need to feel you inside me.

[Curtis removes Jocilyn's hairpin and places it on the table. They embrace and kiss passionately. As Jocilyn takes off Curtis' shirt, she is shocked to see the scars on his body - the result of his savage sexual experience with Therese. Curtis notices the shocked expression on Jocilyn's face, looks down, and realizes that she understood he had sex with another woman. Jocilyn backs off, hurt and disgusted]
Jesus... Jocilyn, I...
Shut up!
Jocilyn, I...

[deeply hurt]
Just shut up! You son of a bitch... just come back to your filthy whore. You two can have each other!
[Jocilyn storms outside with tears]
[Curtis enters the network room at WynTech. Suddenly a hand touches his shoulder. Scared, he turns around and is relieved to see it is Trevor]
Trev! You scared the crap out of me. I...
Curtis, listen, listen. I've been digging deep into the company network. Leave it alone, man. It's bad.
I can't, Trev. I can't let it go.
You... you don't get it, Curtis. I gave myself top clearance. I saw. They've been syntesizing illegal drugs. Curtis, they've killed before.
Oh, my God...
I'm... I'm going to the cops. No job is worth this. But Curtis, I want you to stay out of it. I don't want you to get hurt.
[Curtis hugs Trevor. When he tries to kiss Trevor, Trevor gently stops him]
Curtis, you know I love you.

[Curtis nods. Suddenly, strange noise is heard from under Trevor's shirt. Trevor is pulled by invisible force to the wire board. Wires and cables wrap around Trevor's body. Curtis tries to help Trevor get loose, but to no avail. A wire wrapped around Trevor's face turns his head to the side, breaking his neck. Curtis bursts into tears as he put Trevor's body on the floor]

[screaming in tears]
No! Not Trevor! Die, you son of a bitch!
[suddenly, the door slams, and the lights go off. The room is illuminated with pale green light. Curtis sees the Hecatomb moving in the air towards him]
[Curtis arrives at Dr. Harburg's office and knocks on the door. No answer]
Dr. Harburg?
a pile of slime, in it what was left from Dr. Harburg's face. Curtis turns aside, feels sick]
Beautiful work, Curtis. Just spectacular.
[Curtis looks around and sees the Hecatomb taunting him]
The good doctor is totally your masterpiece!
I didn't do it! I couldn't have! I wasn't even here!
You didn't use your hands, Curtis. You don't have to. You used your mind. Your diseased, twisted, murderous mind.
[the security guard enters]

[gestures toward the Hecamob]
Get it! Just get it!

[looks at that direction but sees nothing of the Hecatomb]
oh, boy...

[the guard draws a gun, and gestures Curtis to move aside. As the guard bends to look behind the desk, Curtis shoves him to the floor and runs away. The guard falls and is shocked to see what was left of Dr. Harburg]
Jesus, Doc...
[At Dr. Harburg's clinic]

[Opens the door. Curtis comes in]
Hello, Curtis. What's bothering you today?

[remains standing]
Everything.
I heard about Tom Ravell's murder, Curtis. Is that why you've come?
Yeah... that really got to me for some reason. Wait a minute... how do you know about Tom? Has WynTech tried to check up on me or something?
No, not at all, Curtis. Detective Powell came and spoke with me this morning.
I don't know what it doesn't make me feel a little better.

Curtis, I can't help you if you keep things from me. Have you been having more problems than you told me about? Because if you're having, say, delusions or... or blackouts or hallucinations, you need to tell me right away.
I'd rather die.
Not at all. I haven't spoken to Dr. Marek in months. I'm just trying to help you get better.
If I were having delusions or... hallucinations, what would you suggest I did?
I would want to check into a hospital for observation, Curtis.
I will NOT go back there! I'd blow my goddamn head first!
It doesn't have to be Greenwood, Curtis. We can take you to a private facility...

[exploding in rage, he knocks the snow-globe off the desk. Dr. Harburg stands still, fearfully]
Shut up! You stay away from me.
[Curtis leaves]

[talking to tape recorder]
Patient Curtis Craig has just experienced a psychotic episode, marked with severe paranoia and irrational anger.
[Dr. Harburg sighs]
[Curtis just heard from detective Powell that Therese was murdered. Deeply shocked, he calls Dr. Harburg's office]
Dr. Rikki Harburg's office. How may I help you?

[chocked with tears]
I... I have to see Dr. Harburg right away. I'm... I'm having problems, and I am...
Yes, sir. I'll get her right away. Please hold.
This is Dr. Harburg.

Doc, this is Curtis. I'm... I'm having troubles. I need to see you. I... it's Therese... she... she's murdered, and I... oh, God, don't tell Dr. Marek. He's in on it. I mean they're all in on it, and I... oh, God, Doc, I have to see you. I have to see you now.
It will be alright, Curtis. Come on over, OK?
Yeah... yeah... OK.
[Curtis hangs the phone. Dr. Harburg calls the receptionist]
What can I do for you, Dr. Rikki?

Tricia, could you alert security? One of my patients is on his way over, and I believe he is in the middle of psychotic episode. But please, don't have him intercepted. Just ask security to be ready if I call, alright?
Well do, Doctor.
[Suddenly Dr. Harburg hears strange noise comes out of the receiver. She places it back, picks it up, and when the noise continues - she unscrews the receiver. To her horror, she finds it is bugged]
Oh, shit...
[Dr. Harburg removes the device from the receiver]
Oh, Marek... oh, you spy son of a bitch!
[Dr. Harburg throws the device away, deep in thoughts. At last she realizes Curtis is sane, and he was right all along about the conspiracy of Wyntech]
Curtis, you were right!
He's mine!
[as Dr. Harburg raises her head, the lights go off]
Hello, Paul Warner. We have not been successful in attempt to synthesize compounds requested. Small living materials'd be useful. Larger ones are better. More, please.
[Paul Warner sneaks into the room behind Curtis, closes the door. Curtis turns around, sees Warner points a gun at him]
Don't move, Curtis. Oh, how I wish it wouldn't have come to this.
[Warner chuckles]
What the hell I was just talking to, Paul?
Creatures from dimension X, of course.
You killed my father, didn't you?
He became a liability. Not everyone is strong enough to handle the sacrifice of human subjects for research.
You son of a bitch!
You know, it's a good thing your dear old dad never knew he didn't really get his little boy back. He'd have lost his nerves much sooner.
What are you talking about?
Don't you remember? I threw poor little Curtis in there...
Warner grabs little Curtis, carrying him to the Threshold. Little Curtis desperately yells "Dad! Dad! Help!"]

...but he never came out. You did. You're a replica, you're some kind of imitation human those things on the other side put together out of slime and dead rats and a little bit of Curtis' brain tissue. Oh, I told your father it was you, that it had been a terrible accident, and he believed me, because he wanted to.
No!
Yes. I'm afraid so. You started remembering a year ago, that's why we put you in the hospital, to observe you.
[Warner laughs]
I should say to observe you more closely. You see, we've been watching you like a bug in a jar even since those things spit you out of Threshold.
Where am I? Where is HE?
[the Hecatomb appears and knocks Warner unconscious. Curtis watches in horror]
Do allow me to introduce myself. Curtis Craig, at your service.
[the Hecatomb confronts Curtis at the Threshold]

[whimpering]
Oh, god, I'm so sorry...

Are you? Are you sorry that my body is a sickening operation? Are you sorry that I haven't slept for twenty years? I've been awake, Curtis, watching you, building my towers so that I can smash you, destroy you, take you life the way you took mine!
It wasn't my fault. I didn't do it to you. I... I'm a victim too.

[teasing]
Oh, baby... your pain will stop very soon, once your mind and your body will be mine. I almost got you, you know, when you were in the asylum. Almost.
No... no! Don't!
It's time to go now, Curtis. Say goodbye to your sanity!

[the Hecatomb holds the severed head of Curtis' mother. Bolts of energy are shot out of her eyes and mouth, hitting Curtis' chest, making him fall on his knees, writhing in agony. Curtis manages to press a switch on the Threshold control panel, opening the doorway to the alien dimension - wide circle of swirling green mass. Curtis jumps through it]
Don't look at me!
[the Hecatomb appears]
Go rot your own pestering brain!

Curtis finds himself at operating room in Greenwood sanitarium, lying on operating table. Dr. Marek, the sadistic sanitarium manager, stands near him. Curtis lifts his head, but Dr. Marek pushes him back. Dr. Marek picks a scalpel and examines it at the light]
Now then... let's see what little mutant boy is made of.
Let me go, please. Please, I haven't done anything!
Your very existence is abomination.
Curtis finds himself at the Dreaming Tree cafe, sitting with Jocilyn]
I love you, Curtis... even though you've been cheating on me with Therese. I love you.
Joce...
[Jocilyn kisses Curtis passionately. She presses a gun under his chin]
I love you too much to ever let you go.
Curtis finds himself in a messy room, its floor covered with water puddles and gore, torn piped hang from the ceiling, dripping water and smoke]

Curtis finds himself in a messy room, its floor covered with water puddles and gore, torn piped hang from the ceiling, dripping water and smoke. The dead body of Trevor appears, his neck broken and bloody in the same condition as he died]
I was wondering when you plan dragging your lazy ass in here.
Trev?
[as Trevor advances, Curtis steps back. His foot slips on puddle, and he falls. Next to him, the dead body of Bob comes to life - also in the same condition he was killed, his mouth stapled]
Before you forget, big boy!
[Curtis crawls back. From his pocket falls keycard. The dead body of Tom appears and approaches, dragging a sledgehammer]

[to Bob]
Get away from me!
Come a little closer, ratboy.
[Bob shows Curtis bloody letter opener, one of the tools which were used to kill Bob]
You got something in your eye.

[to Tom]
Tom... Tom, I swear to god, it wasn't my fault. Tom, it wasn't my fault!

[to Trevor]
Trev, please... oh, god. Trev, please don't hurt me.
Curtis, I only want to kill us.

[as the three zombies get closer, Curtis grabs the keycard. Rushing to the elevator, he narrowly evades Tom's sledgehammer. The blow bashes Bob's head instead. Curtis passes the keycard at the elevator sensor. Nothing happens. Curtis watches in horror at Trevor and Tom getting closer]
Shit!
Curtis finds himself at the Borderline club, strapped by leather cuffs to bed. Therese sits astride on his waist, dressed provocatively in black leather]

[moaning in pleasure]
That was hot, baby. That was really, really hot.
Curtis finds himself as little boy at his parents' house, playing with toys at the yard. His lunatic mother comes outside]
Curtis... come here, Curtis sweetheart. I have something for you.
[Curtis' insane mother approaches him, holding gardening shears behind her back, murder intent on her mind. Little Curtis stands. Instead of running away, he walks to his mother]
I love you, mom.

[little Curtis hugs his mother. This gesture of affection calms her down. She lets go of the shears, all murder thoughts disappear from her disturbed mind. Bursting into tears, she gently hugs and kisses her son. The surrounding changes back to the alien world. As Curtis passed successfully all the psychotic episodes, the Hecatomb is weakened. It still shoots at Curtis, but harmlessly. Its head drops, liquid oozes from its mouth. It fades and disappears as Curtis passes through it harmlessly. Curtis approaches the real Curtis and tears piece of the material covering it, revealing its face - identical to Curtis', staring at him in horror. It tries to hit Curtis, but Curtis easily grabs its wrist, pushing its hand back. Curtis pulls the plug on the real Curtis and walks away]

[after Curtis fixes the circuit board at the alien dimension, the doorway opens. Curtis passes through it back to reality. Curtis is again at the Threshold control room. Jocilyn enters. They look at each other in silence for long moment. At last Jocilyn speaks]
Curtis, I know. I know wha... who you are. I love you. Please, stay with me.
Hello, Paul Warner. The doorway has been damaged. It has become unstable. We wish the Twin to return to us. It does not belong on your side.
[Curtis, realizing that he is an alien, must choose whether to return the alien world forever, or stay at the real world with Jocilyn]
Curtis chooses to return to the alien world]

[hugging Jocilyn]
We'll talk about it, Joce.
[Curtis looks at Paul Warner regaining consciousness, groaning, starting to rise]

[to Jocilyn]
I'll do what's right. I promise.
his severed head hangs by several veins, groaning in pain, his eyes stare in horror]
Curtis chooses to stay at the real world. Some time later, people at the Dreaming Tree are discussing the recent events]
Can you believe that big time exec like Paul Warner killed all those people?
Sure I do! Suits are evil, you know.
Where do you suppose he is now?
[Curtis and Jocilyn are sitting at the Dreaming Tree. Jocilyn talks excitedly about their vacation]
You're gonna love the bikini I got. It is so tiny. I swear, it's this big.
[Jocilyn chuckles]
blue Mediterranean Sea, sun-washed beaches... oh, you're not gonna regret this, Curtis. I promise.
his severed head hangs by several veins, groaning in pain, his eyes stare in horror]
